member.name: T:GCheckout.GCheckoutRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods for sending API requests to Google Checkout.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,GCheckout.EnvironmentType,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called by the class and initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Google Checkout merchant ID assigned to a particular merchant.
The Google Checkout merchant key assigned to a particular merchant.
The environment where a request is being executed. Valid values for this parameter are "Sandbox" and "Production".
The currency associated with prices in a Checkout API request. At this time, the only supported currency value is "USD", which corresponds to U.S. dollars.
The length of time, in minutes, after which the shopping cart will expire if it has not been submitted. A value of 0 indicates the cart does not expire.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddItem(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method adds an item to an order. This method handles items that do not have <merchant-private-item-data> XML blocks associated with them.
member.param: The name of the item. This value corresponds to the value of the <item-name> tag in the Checkout API request.
The description of the item. This value corresponds to the value of the <item-description> tag in the Checkout API request.
The price of the item. This value corresponds to the value of the <unit-price> tag in the Checkout API request.
The number of this item that is included in the order. This value corresponds to the value of the <quantity> tag in the Checkout API request.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddItem(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: This method adds an item to an order. This method handles items that have <merchant-private-item-data> XML blocks associated with them.
member.param: The name of the item. This value corresponds to the value of the <item-name> tag in the Checkout API request.
The description of the item. This value corresponds to the value of the <item-description> tag in the Checkout API request.
The price of the item. This value corresponds to the value of the <unit-price> tag in the Checkout API request.
The number of this item that is included in the order. This value corresponds to the value of the <quantity> tag in the Checkout API request.
An XML block that should be associated with the item in the Checkout API request. This value corresponds to the value of the value of the <merchant-private-item-data> tag in the Checkout API request.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddFlatRateShippingMethod(System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: This method adds a flat-rate shipping method to an order. This method handles flat-rate shipping methods that do not have shipping restrictions.
member.param: The name of the shipping method. This value will be displayed on the Google Checkout order review page.
The cost associated with the shipping method.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddFlatRateShippingMethod(System.String,System.Decimal,GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions)
member.summary: This method adds a flat-rate shipping method to an order. This method handles flat-rate shipping methods that have shipping restrictions.
member.param: The name of the shipping method. This value will be displayed on the Google Checkout order review page.
The cost associated with the shipping method.
A list of country, state or zip code areas where the shipping method is either available or unavailable.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddMerchantCalculatedShippingMethod(System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: This method adds a merchant-calculated shipping method to an order. This method handles merchant-calculated shipping methods that do not have shipping restrictions.
member.param: The name of the shipping method. This value will be displayed on the Google Checkout order review page.
The default cost associated with the shipping method. This value is the amount that Gogle Checkout will charge for shipping if the merchant calculation callback request fails.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddMerchantCalculatedShippingMethod(System.String,System.Decimal,GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions)
member.summary: This method adds a merchant-calculated shipping method to an order. This method handles merchant-calculated shipping methods that have shipping restrictions.
member.param: The name of the shipping method. This value will be displayed on the Google Checkout order review page.
The default cost associated with the shipping method. This value is the amount that Gogle Checkout will charge for shipping if the merchant calculation callback request fails.
A list of country, state or zip code areas where the shipping method is either available or unavailable.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddPickupShippingMethod(System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: This method adds an instore-pickup shipping option to an order.
member.param: The name of the shipping method. This value will be displayed on the Google Checkout order review page.
The cost associated with the shipping method.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddNewShippingMethod(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds the new shipping method.
member.param: The new shipping method.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddZipTaxRule(System.String,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method adds a tax rule associated with a zip code pattern.
member.param: The zip pattern.
The tax rate associated with a tax rule. Tax rates are expressed as decimal values. For example, a value of 0.0825 specifies a tax rate of 8.25%.
If this parameter has a value of true, then shipping costs will be taxed for items that use the associated tax rule.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.IsValidZipPattern(System.String)
member.summary: This method verifies that a given zip code pattern is valid. Zip code patterns may be five-digit numbers or they may be one- to four-digit numbers followed by an asterisk.
member.param: This parameter contains the zip code pattern that is being evaluated.
member.returns: This method returns true if the provided zip code pattern is valid, meaning it is either a series of five digits or it is a series of zero to four digits followed by an asterisk. If the zip code pattern is not valid, this method returns false.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddStateTaxRule(System.String,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method adds a tax rule associated with a particular state.
member.param: This parameter contains a two-letter U.S. state code associated with a tax rule.
The tax rate associated with a tax rule. Tax rates are expressed as decimal values. For example, a value of 0.0825 specifies a tax rate of 8.25%.
If this parameter has a value of true, then shipping costs will be taxed for items that use the associated tax rule.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddCountryTaxRule(GCheckout.AutoGen.USAreas,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the country tax rule. This method adds a tax rule associated with a particular state.
member.param: The area.
The tax rate associated with a tax rule. Tax rates are expressed as decimal values. For example, a value of 0.0825 specifies a tax rate of 8.25%.
If this parameter has a value of true, then shipping costs will be taxed for items that use the associated tax rule.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AddNewTaxRule(GCheckout.AutoGen.DefaultTaxRule)
member.summary: This method adds a new tax rule to the <default-tax-table>. This method is called by the methods that create the XML blocks for flat-rate shipping, merchant-calculated shipping and instore-pickup shipping methods.
member.param: This parameter contains an object representing a default tax rule.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.GetXml
member.summary: This method generates the XML for a Checkout API request. This method also calls the CheckPreConditions method, which verifies that if the API request indicates that the merchant will calculate tax and shipping costs, that the input data for those calculations is included in the request.
member.returns: This method returns the XML for a Checkout API request.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.CheckPreConditions
member.summary: This method is used to perform several checks that verify the integrity of the information in a Checkout API XML request. This method will throw an exception if the request does not pass any of these tests.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.MakeXmlElement(System.String)
member.summary: This method is used to construct the <merchant-private-data> and <merchant-private-item-data> XML elements. Both of these elements contain freeform XML blocks that are specified by the merchant.
member.param: The XML.
member.returns: This method returns the element value for either the <merchant-private-data> or the <merchant-private-item-data> XML element.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.SetExpirationMinutesFromNow(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method sets the value of the <good-until-date> using the value of the CartExpirationMinutes parameter. This method converts that value into Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
member.param: The length of time, in minutes, after which the shopping cart should expire. This property contains the value of the CartExpirationMinutes property.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.MerchantCalculatedTax
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves a value that indicates whether the merchant is responsible for calculating taxes for the default tax table.
member.value: The value of this property should be true if the merchant will calculate taxes for the order. Otherwise, this value should be false. The value should only be true if the merchant has implemented the Merchant Calculations API.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AcceptMerchantCoupons
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves a value that indicates whether the merchant accepts coupons. If this value is set to true, the Google Checkout order confirmation page will display a text field where the customer can enter a coupon code.
member.value: This value of this property is a Boolean value that indicates whether the merchant accepts coupons. This value should only be set to true if the merchant has implemented the Merchant Calculations API.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.AcceptMerchantGiftCertificates
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves a value that indicates whether the merchant accepts gift certificates. If this value is set to true, the Google Checkout order confirmation page will display a text field where the customer can enter a gift certificate code.
member.value: This value of this property is a Boolean value that indicates whether the merchant accepts gift certificates. This value should only be set to true if the merchant has implemented the Merchant Calculations API.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.MerchantCalculationsUrl
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves the value of the <merchant-calculations-url> element. This value is the URL to which Google Checkout will send <merchant-calculation-callback> requests. This property is only relevant for merchants who are implementing the Merchant Calculations API.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.MerchantPrivateData
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves the value of the <merchant-private-data> element.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.ContinueShoppingUrl
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves the value of the <continue-shopping-url> element. Google Checkout will display a link to this URL on the page that the customer sees after completing her purchase.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.EditCartUrl
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves the value of the <edit-cart-url> element. Google Checkout will display a link to this URL on the Google Checkout order confirmation page. The customer can click this link to edit the shopping cart contents before completing a purchase.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.RequestBuyerPhoneNumber
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves the value of the <request-buyer-phone-number> element. If this value is true, the buyer must enter a phone number to complete a purchase.
member.value: true if the Google should send the buyer's phone number to the merchant, otherwise false.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.CartExpiration
member.summary: This property sets or retrieves the value of the <good-until-date> element.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.CheckoutShoppingCartRequest.ShoppingCartItem.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method initializes a new instance of the class, which creates an object corresponding to an individual item in an order. This method is used for items that do not have an associated <merchant-private-item-data> XML block.
member.param: The name of the item.
A description of the item.
The price of the item.
The number of the item that is included in the order.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.OnInit(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: On initialization, this class calls the SetImageUrl method.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.SetImageUrl
member.summary: This method creates the URL for the Google Checkout button image. This method uses the value of the "Size" property to set the width and height of the image. It also uses the value of the "Background" property to set a style that dictates the background color for the image. Finally, the method uses the value of the "Environment

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.CreateRequest
member.summary: This method calls the class to initialize a new instance of that class. Before doing so, this method verifies that the MerchantID, MerchantKey and Environment properties have all been set.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.Size
member.summary: The Size property value determines the size of the Google Checkout button that will display on your web page. Valid values for this property are "Small", "Medium" and "Large". A small button is 160 pixels wide and 43 pixels high. A medium button is 168 pixels wide and 44 pixels high. A large button is 180 pixels wide and 46 pixels high.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.MerchantID
member.summary: The GoogleMerchantID property value identifies your Google Checkout Merchant ID. This value should be set in your web.config file.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.MerchantKey
member.summary: The GoogleMerchantKey property value identifies your Google Checkout Merchant key. This value should be set in your web.config file.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.Environment
member.summary: The GoogleEnvironment property value identifies the environment in which your application is running. In your test environment, the value of the GoogleEnvironment property should be Sandbox. In your production environment, the value of the property should be Production.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.Background
member.summary: The Background property value indicates whether the Google Checkout button should be displayed on a white background or a transparent background. Valid values for this property are "White" and "Transparent".

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.Currency
member.summary: The Currency property value identifies the currency that should be associated with prices in your Checkout API requests. The value of this property should be a three-letter ISO 4217 currency code. At this time, the only supported currency is U.S. dollars ("USD").

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.GCheckoutButton.CartExpirationMinutes
member.summary: The CartExpirationMinutes property value identifies the length of time, in minutes, after which an unsubmitted shopping cart will become invalid. A value of 0 indicates that the shopping cart does not expire.

member.name: T:GCheckout.Checkout.ButtonSize
member.summary: This enumeration defines valid sizes for the Google Checkout button. Valid values for the "Size" property are "Small", "Medium" and "Large".

member.name: T:GCheckout.Checkout.BackgroundType
member.summary: This enumeration defines valid background colors for the Google Checkout button. Valid values for the "Background" property are "White" and "Transparent".

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddAllowedZipPattern(System.String)
member.summary: This method adds an allowed zip code pattern to a <us-zip-area> element. The <us-zip-area> element, in turn, appears as a subelement of <allowed-areas>.
member.param: The zip pattern.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddAllowedStateCode(System.String)
member.summary: This method adds an allowed U.S. state code to a <us-state-area> element. The <us-state-area> element, in turn, appears as a subelement of <allowed-areas>.
member.param: The state code.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddAllowedCountryArea(GCheckout.AutoGen.USAreas)
member.summary: This method adds an allowed U.S. country area to a <us-country-area> element. The <us-country-area> element, in turn, appears as a subelement of <allowed-areas>.
member.param: The country area.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddNewAllowedArea(System.Object)
member.summary: This method adds an allowed zip code area, state area or country area to a Checkout API request.
member.param: The new area.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddExcludedZipPattern(System.String)
member.summary: This method adds an excluded zip code pattern to a <us-zip-area> element. The <us-zip-area> element, in turn, appears as a subelement of <excluded-areas>.
member.param: The zip pattern.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddExcludedStateCode(System.String)
member.summary: This method adds an excluded U.S. state code to a <us-state-area> element. The <us-state-area> element, in turn, appears as a subelement of <excluded-areas>.
member.param: The state code.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddExcludedCountryArea(GCheckout.AutoGen.USAreas)
member.summary: This method adds an excluded U.S. country area to a <us-country-area> element. The <us-country-area> element, in turn, appears as a subelement of <excluded-areas>.
member.param: The country area.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.AddNewExcludedArea(System.Object)
member.summary: This method adds an excluded zip code area, state area or country area to a Checkout API request.
member.param: The new area.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Checkout.ShippingRestrictions.XmlRestrictions
member.summary: This method returns the complete set of shipping restrictions for a Checkout API request.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.AnonymousAddress
member.summary: This class creates an object that identifies the customer's shipping address. Your class that inherits from CallbackRules.cs will receive an object of this type that identifies the customer's shipping address.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.CallbackProcessor
member.summary: This class contains methods that parse a <merchant-calculation-callback> request, allowing you to access items in the request, shipping methods, shipping addresses, tax information, and coupon and gift certificate codes entered by the customer.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.CallbackRules
member.summary: This abstract class defines methods for constructing a <merchant-calculation-results> XML response.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.ExampleRules
member.summary: This class contains a sample class that inherits from CallbackRules.cs. This class demonstrates how you could subclass CallbackRules.cs to define your own merchant-calculated shipping, tax and coupon options.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.MerchantCodeResult
member.summary: This class creates an object to indicate whether the coupon and gift certificate codes that were supplied by the customer are valid. The object also indicates whether the code is for a coupon, gift certificate or other discount as well as the amount of the credit associated with the code. Your class that inherits from CallbackRules.cs will access these objects to calculate discounts associated with coupons and gift certificates.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.Order
member.summary: This class contains methods that parse a <merchant-calculation-callback> request and creates an object identifying the items in the customer's shopping cart. Your class that inherits from CallbackRules.cs will receive an object of this type to identify the items in the customer's order.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.OrderLine
member.summary: This class creates an object for an individual item identified in a <merchant-calculation-callback> request. Your class that inherits from CallbackRules.cs can access these objects to locate information about each item in an order. See the GetTaxResult method in the ExampleRules.cs file for an example of how your application might access these objects.

member.name: T:GCheckout.MerchantCalculation.ShippingResult
member.summary: This class creates an object to indicate the cost of a particular shipping method and the availability of that shipping method for the designated shipping address.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.AddMerchantOrderNumberRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <add-merchant-order-number> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.AddTrackingDataRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <add-tracking-data> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.ArchiveOrderRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <archive-order> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.CancelOrderRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <cancel-order> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.ChargeOrderRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <charge-order> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.DeliverOrderRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <deliver-order> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.ProcessOrderRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <process-order> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.RefundOrderRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <refund-order> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.SendBuyerMessageRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <send-buyer-message> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.OrderProcessing.UnarchiveOrderRequest
member.summary: This class contains methods that construct <unarchive-order> API requests.

member.name: T:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule
member.summary: If you are processing notifications or merchant calculation callback requests, but you do not want to turn on basic HTTP authentication in IIS, you can use this class to validate the incoming API requests from Google Checkout.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class. This is done by IIS.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the module that implements

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Inits the specified application. This will be called by the system.
member.param: The HTTP application.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule.OnAuthenticateRequest(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when IIS asks to authenticate an HTTP request.
member.param: The calling HttpApplication.
The instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule.OnEndRequest(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called by the system when the HTTP request ends.
member.param: The calling HttpApplication.
The instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule.GetUserName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of the user from the "Authorization" HTTP header. That header has user name and password (as typed by the user) in a Base64-encoded form.
member.param: The value of the "Authorization" HTTP header.
member.returns: The name of the user as typed by the user in the browser.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.BasicAuthenticationModule.GetPassword(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the password from the "Authorization" HTTP header. That header has user name and password (as typed by the user) in a Base64-encoded form.
member.param: The value of the "Authorization" HTTP header.
member.returns: The password as typed by the user in the browser.

member.name: T:GCheckout.Util.EncodeHelper
member.summary: Collection of various encode-related static methods.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.EncodeHelper.StringToUtf8Bytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string to bytes in UTF-8 encoding.
member.param: The string to convert.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.EncodeHelper.Utf8BytesToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts bytes in UTF-8 encoding to a regular string.
member.param: The UTF-8 bytes.
member.returns: The input bytes as a string.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.EncodeHelper.GetTopElement(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the top element of an XML string.
member.param: The XML string to extract the top element from.
member.returns: The name of the first regular XML element.
member.example:
Calling GetTopElement(Xml) where Xml is:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <new-order-notification xmlns="http://checkout.google.com/schema/2" serial-number="85f54628-538a-44fc-8605-ae62364f6c71"> <google-order-number>841171949013218</google-order-number> ... <new-order-notification>
will return the string new-order-notification.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.EncodeHelper.Deserialize(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Makes an object out of the specified XML.
member.param: The XML that should be made into an object.
Type of object that produced the XML.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.EncodeHelper.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Makes XML out of an object.
member.param: The object to serialize.
member.returns: An XML string representing the object.

member.name: T:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse
member.summary: This request contains methods that handle a <checkout-redirect> response from Google Checkout and capture the URL to which a customer should be redirected to complete the checkout process.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The XML returned from Google.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current GCheckoutResponse. Intended for debugging only.
member.returns: A human-readable that represents the current GCheckoutResponse. Note that the format of the string may change in future releases.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse.IsGood
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Google returned an error code or not.
member.value: true if the response did not indicate an error; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse.SerialNumber
member.summary: Gets the serial number. Google attaches a unique serial number to every response.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse.ErrorMessage
member.summary: If Google responded with an error (IsGood = false) then this property will contain the human-readable error message.
member.value: The error message returned by Google, or an empty string if there was no error.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse.RedirectUrl
member.summary: If Google indicated a redirect URL in the response, this property will contain the URL string.
member.value: The redirect URL, or the empty string if Google didn't send a redirect URL.

member.name: P:GCheckout.Util.GCheckoutResponse.ResponseXml
member.summary: Gets the response XML sent by Google.
member.value: The response XML sent by Google.

member.name: T:GCheckout.Util.Log
member.summary: This class contains methods that write messages, including debugging and error information, to log files.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.Log.WriteToFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a string to a file.
member.param: Path and name of the file.
The line to write.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.Log.Debug(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a debug message to the file X\debug.txt where X is read from the config file key "LogDirectory".
member.param: The debug message to write.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.Log.Err(System.String)
member.summary: Writes an error message to the file X\error.txt where X is read from the config file key "LogDirectory".
member.param: The error message to write.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.Log.LoggingOn
member.summary: Returns true if logging is on, that is if the config file contains values for a key for "LogDirectory" and if the value for the key "Logging" is "true".
member.returns: True if the config keys are correct.

member.name: M:GCheckout.Util.Log.GetLogPath
member.summary: Gets the log path, that is the value of the "LogDirectory" key in the config file.
